disorders.name: Intellectual Disability
criteria: 1: Deficits in Intellectual functioning
2: Deficits in Adaptive Functioning (communication, social, work, school)
3: Onset during developmental period

disorders.name: Global Developmental Delay
criteria: 1: Must be under 5 years old
2: Diagnostic criteria for Intellecutal Disability are impossible to evaluate with available tools because of young age
3: Fails to meet developmental milestones in more than one area of intellectual functioning

disorders.name: Unspecified Intellectual Disability
criteria: 1: Must be at least 5 years
2: Diagnostic criteria for Intellecutal Disability are impossible to evaluate with available tools because of sensory or physical impairments

disorders.name: Language Disorder
disorders.description: Persistent difficulties in acquisition or use of language (spoken, written, sign, other)
criteria: 1: Reduced Vocabulary
2: Limited Sentence Structure
3: Impaired Discourse (explaining, describing, coversation)
4: Language level Substantially and Quantifiably below expected for age leading to impairment
5: Onset in early development
6: Not attrbuted to hearing, motor, or other medical condition

disorders.name: Speech Sound Disorder
criteria: 1: Difficulty with sound production preventing intelligible verbal communication
2: Impairment present in social, work, or school domains
3: Onset in early development
4: Not attributed to congenital or acquired conditions (cerebal palsy, cleft palate, hearing loss, TBI, or other medical conditions)

disorders.name: Childhood-Onset Fluency Disorder (Stuttering)
disorders.criteria_req: (Must meet all of 1-3, plus one or more of 4-10)
criteria: 1: Symptoms are anxiety provoking or impairing in social, work, or school domains
2: Onset in early development
3: Not attributed to motor-deficit, sensory-deficit, or prior neurologic insult (stroke, TBI, tumor)
4: Sound and syllable repetitions
5: Prolongation of constants and vowels
6: Pauses within a word
7: Filled or unfilled pauses during speech
8: Avoiding problematic words via word substitution
9: Excessive physical tension related to word production
10: Monosyllabic whole-word repetition

disorders.name: Social (Pragmatic) Communication Disorder
criteria: 1: Impaired ability to communicate for the purpose of socializing
2: Impaired ability to match communication to context (formal vs informal etc.)
3: Impaired ability to follow rules of conversation (e.g. taking turns)
4: Impaired ability to understand idioms or what is not explicitly stated
5: Impairment present in social, work, or school domains
6: Onset in early development
7: Not attributed to another medical condition or better explained by another DSM diagnosis

disorders.name: Uspecified Communication Disorder
criteria: 1: Distress or impairement in social, work, or school domains related to communication
2: Criteria for other communication or developmental disorders not fully met

disorders.name: Persistent (Chronic) Motor or Vocal Tic Disorder

category: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
